decisions_made.exploration_depth: Dig deep on business complexity and any unique architectural pieces where the domain logic is different (e.g., email subsystem vs payment subsystem vs user forum subsystem). Only need to go to behavioral acceptance criteria level (exploration phase), not domain acceptance criteria. Rest can be extrapolated at future levels within epic or sub-epic.
decisions_made.scope_level: End-to-end user-system behavior – One user interaction followed by one system response. Focus on user hitting the website and all the things the website can do.

assumptions_made.drill_down_areas: Business complexity (unique domain logic, unique system flows, common subsystems like email/payments/forums), Unique architectural pieces where domain logic differs

decisions_made.slice_approach: Combination of End-to-End Journey, Maximizing Earned Value, and Validating Impact-Feasibility approaches
decisions_made.increment_strategy: Phase 1 increments organized as vertical slices delivering complete user journeys

increment_1.name: Foundation & Discovery
increment_1.focus: User accounts + basic profiles + basic search
increment_1.value: Enables all other features, validates user interest

increment_2.name: Merchandise Sharing
increment_2.focus: Upload merchandise photos + view posts + basic collections

increment_3.name: Basic Trading
increment_3.focus: Mark items for trade + create/view proposals + basic completion
increment_3.value: Differentiates platform, derisks complex trading flow

increment_4.name: Fan Films
increment_4.focus: Upload fan films + watch films + basic metadata

assumptions_made.thin_slices_provide_value: Thin slices should provide either value, learning, or risk reduction
assumptions_made.slices_need_not_be_complete: Slices do not need to include all functionality to be useful
assumptions_made.not_all_user_visible: Not every increment must be user-visible if it validates key assumptions
assumptions_made.architectural_slices_allowed: Some slices may be architectural if they unlock multiple features
assumptions_made.end_to_end_journeys: Each increment should deliver a complete user journey where possible
assumptions_made.phase_1_priority: Phase 1 must launch first: User accounts, Merchandise sharing, Basic trading, Fan movies, Search

decisions_made.folder_structure_approach: Create epic and feature folders matching story graph hierarchy in docs/stories/map/ directory
decisions_made.archive_obsolete: Archive obsolete folders to map/z_archive/[timestamp]/ (NEVER delete)

assumptions_made.structured_content_ready: structured.json exists with complete story graph

decisions_made.story_definition_approach: Skinny then Elaborate - Create the smallest spine you can (minimal viable flow) and then go back and add different alternates and options. Build the core path first: account creation → profile → search, then expand.
decisions_made.story_granularity: User/system level interactions - gives clarity for design, testing, and responsibility. Focus on user-system interaction points for design and testing clarity.

assumptions_made.default_granularity: One meaningful user/system interaction per story
assumptions_made.granularity_varies: Story granularity may vary based on technical or functional complexity
assumptions_made.coarse_grained_acceptable: Coarse-grained stories are acceptable where functionality is easily enabled
assumptions_made.fine_grained_required: Fine-grained slicing is required where architectural or integration uncertainty is high

decisions_made.granularity_level: User-System Behavioral – Focus on each point of interaction (user input, system response). Ideal when precision in behavior is key.
decisions_made.ac_completion_criteria: Stop when criteria capture a full back-and-forth (user-system-user). Ensures atomic and testable slices. Also constrained to a reasonable number (under 9 AC per story).
decisions_made.ac_consolidation_approach: Same logic, different data → Consolidate. Different formulas → Keep separate. Different validation rules → Keep separate.
decisions_made.ac_format: Behavioral AC in When/Then format for all stories
decisions_made.domain_ac_location: Domain AC aggregated at increment level (not story level)
decisions_made.story_reshaping: Stories may be merged or split based on AC count and complexity
decisions_made.ac_count_guidelines: Simple stories: 2-3 AC, Medium: 4-6 AC, Complex: 5-7 AC (max 9)
decisions_made.no_scenarios: Scenarios belong in specification phase, not exploration

assumptions_made.each_story_has_behavioral_ac: Each story includes behavioral acceptance criteria (When/Then format)
assumptions_made.domain_ac_at_increment_level: Domain AC belongs at increment level (aggregated from features)
assumptions_made.ac_defines_flow: ACs define end-to-end flow, not isolated rules
assumptions_made.exploration_reshapes_stories: Exploration may result in story reshaping (merging/splitting)
assumptions_made.scenarios_in_specification: Story documentation (scenarios) belongs in specification phase, NOT exploration
